(cont'd)

"... In return the adherent receives what the religions had once given him more universally: a world view, a hierarchy of importances, and an auguring place where he may find out what to do and think, in short, a total explanation of man. And this totality is obtained not by actually explaining everything, but by an encasement of its activity, a severe and absolute restriction of attention, such that everything that is not explained is not in view."

(Certainly this is well illustrated in astrophysics! - Mel Acheson)

- Julian Jaynes, The Origin of Consciousness in the Breakdown of the Bicameral Mind
